title: Bug 6322 - All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: When using JDK 1.4, the Open Type dialog displays obfuscated classes (such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') alongside other classes.
OB: The obfuscated classes appear prominently in the Open Type dialog.
EB: The Open Type dialog should not display obfuscated classes, and should only show relevant and non-obfuscated classes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the Open Type dialog.
2. Observe the presence of obfuscated classes (such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') in the list.
3. Expectedly, only non-obfuscated and relevant classes should be shown in the list.
